DataElement.preferredDefinition: The reason a person is not receiving therapy and is considered off treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to disposition._When a patient is not receiving therapy they are considered off treatment.  In clinical trials, a dosing schedule may require a patient to stop medication for a period of time, then resume, such as 28 days on and 7 days off.

PermissibleValues.value: Patient Refusal (not related to adverse events)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a study participant has removed themself from the study or from one or more segments of the study.: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a study participant has removed themself from the study or from one or more segments of the study.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

PermissibleValues.value: Adverse Events - related to protocol treatment
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Adverse Event Definitely Related to Intervention Adverse Event

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Adverse Event Definitely Related to Intervention Adverse Event
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A characteristic used to qualify the adverse event as certainly related to the medical intervention. According to WHO causality assessment criteria of suspected adverse reactions it is applicable to a clinical event, including laboratory test abnormality, occurring in a plausible time relationship to medical intervention, and which cannot be explained by concurrent disease or other interventions. The response to withdrawal of the medical product (dechallenge) should be clinically plausible. The event must be definitive pharmacologically or phenomenologically, using a satisfactory rechallenge procedure if necessary.: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.longName: Adverse Event Definitely Related to Intervention
Concepts.definition: A characteristic used to qualify the adverse event as certainly related to the medical intervention. According to WHO causality assessment criteria of suspected adverse reactions it is applicable to a clinical event, including laboratory test abnormality, occurring in a plausible time relationship to medical intervention, and which cannot be explained by concurrent disease or other interventions. The response to withdrawal of the medical product (dechallenge) should be clinically plausible. The event must be definitive pharmacologically or phenomenologically, using a satisfactory rechallenge procedure if necessary.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

PermissibleValues.value: Intercurrent Illness - adverse events unrelated to protocol treatment

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A characteristic used to qualify the adverse event as clearly not related to the medical intervention.

Concepts.definition: A characteristic used to qualify the adverse event as clearly not related to the medical intervention.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time.: Having to do with symptoms, which are signs of a condition or disease.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.
Exhibiting the symptoms of a particular disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.7.26 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002656. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: The cessation of life.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: An effect of a therapeutic intervention that prolongs life, improves function, and/or improves the way a subject feels.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
An effect of a therapeutic intervention that prolongs life, improves function, and/or improves the way a subject feels.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.

Concepts.definition: A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
Available in place of something else.
